dict.string: Bored Tourist uses your camera to take a profile photo so other users can recognize you when joining group experiences. For example, when you book a group surf lesson, your photo helps the instructor identify you. Your camera is never accessed without your explicit action.

Bored Tourist needs your location to display nearby experiences sorted by distance. For example, if you are near Cascais, the app will show 'Kayak Tour - 2km away' at the top of your feed. Your location is only used to calculate distances and is never shared with other users, activity providers, or used for advertising purposes.

Bored Tourist needs your location to display nearby experiences sorted by distance. For example, if you are near Cascais, the app will show 'Kayak Tour - 2km away' at the top of your feed. Your location is only used to calculate distances and is never shared with other users, activity providers, or used for advertising purposes.

Bored Tourist needs your location to display nearby experiences sorted by distance. For example, if you are near Cascais, the app will show 'Kayak Tour - 2km away' at the top of your feed. Your location is only used to calculate distances and is never shared with other users, activity providers, or used for advertising purposes.
Bored Tourist may use your microphone if you choose to record a video review of an experience you have completed. This is optional and only accessed when you explicitly tap the record button.

Bored Tourist needs access to your photo library to let you choose an existing photo for your profile picture. For example, you can select a photo to help other users recognize you when you join group experiences like surf lessons or wine tastings.
